body: Sorry, the thing happens while the less designer has the circular dependency with the less files. Problem solved.
Actually less should handle it. I thought I fixed these issues in 1.7- I will try to repro this with lessc
Just wanted to say that I have the same error with 1.7.0. Haven't found the circular dependency yet... :unamused:

Is anything moving of this at all? Not found any circular dependencies, plus it only happens if you leave it for 5 minutes or so... never happens for me if I run compile less repeatedly, just the first time and then again after it's been left for 5 minutes. Bizarre! @lukeapage

This configuration reproduces what I believe is the same error.

https://github.com/themikecom/misc/raw/master/less-js/rules-undefined.zip

The linked configuration throws the error most of the time on my machine but you may need to run it more than once.

```
c:\>lessc rules-undefined-start.less
non_object_property_loadError: Cannot read property 'rules' of undefined in c:\opensource\less-rules-undefined\rules-undefined-start.less on line null, column 0:
1 @import "rules-undefined/main-include.less";
```

> but you may need to run it more than once.

Sounds like a classic race condition.

This issue is reproduced from time to time. I'm using gulp-less 1.3.2 which uses Less.js 1.7.3 under the hood. I have the scenario described by @rhiadj (several files importing the same dependency). And in my case I want to leave imports as is. It would be cool if Less.js will be able to manage several imports of one dependency in correct way - use it only once. 
Could you please implement this?
@themikecom thanks for the repro, I'll take a look now.

I linked commit - I did indeed find another issue - certain situations cause a file not to be skipped and that file is not processed (because it skips processing it) so it leads to errors. I hope that solves it (finally).
Sorry its taken so long.
Thanks for the fix!  I ran lessc, with the patch, on my less files 1000 times without an issue.
It works i my project. Thanks a lot!
